basics.name: Fernando Aguilar Islas
basics.label: Data Scientist
basics.summary: Current applied statistics graduate student at Penn State and about to graduate Flatiron School's data science bootcamp.

courses: Descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, power, estimation, confidence intervals, regression, one- and two-way ANOVA, chi-square tests, diagnostics.
Analysis of research data through simple and multiple regression and correlation; polynomial models; indicator variables; step-wise, piece-wise, and logistic regression.
Statsitics adn Statistical Models, Machine Leraning, Natural Language Processing

education.institution: University of Miami, Coral Gables, FL
courses: Relevant coursework included, financial analysis, securities valuation, investment management, economic modeling, and statistics.
Developed proficiency in R, Stata, amd MS Office Suite
Study abroad experience in Mexico City at a top economics research university, (CIDE).

work.summary: Head of online presence for Ka Leo
highlights: Maintain, update, and oversee official college newspaper website

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
